required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Evaluation of RMGI/GI Class V Restorations
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Clinical Evaluation of RMGI/GI Class V Restorations Placed by Dental Students

brief_summary.textblock: Brief Summary: Retrospective study to evaluate the clinical performance of two restorative materials - glass-ionomer (GI) and resin-modified glass-ionomer (RMGI) materials - in Class V carious and non-carious cervical lesions restored by dental students.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this retrospective study was to evaluate the clinical performance of glass-ionomer (GI) and resin-modified glass-ionomer (RMGI) materials in Class V carious and non-carious cervical lesions restored by dental students. Ninety-six (96) restorations performed with either GI (Fuji IX) (n=39) or RMGI (Fuji II) (n=57) were evaluated using the modified USPHS (United States Public Health Systems) criteria by two independent investigators at two follow-up evaluations (two years apart). The Fisher statistical test was used to compare USPHS criteria and examine significant differences by setting p<0.05 for statistical significance and the Kaplan-Meier algorithm was used to calculate the survival probability.

primary_outcome.description: Absence of sensitivity to pressure, cold or hot temperature on the teeth restored (checked verbally by inquiring the patient about the presence or absence of pain in the presence of stimuli)
No visual evidence of dark, deep discolouration or cavitation adjacent to the restoration (visually and manually checked with the tip of a dental hand instrument - explorer)
Restoration's anatomy is continuous with existing anatomic form of remaining tooth structure (checked visually with a dental intra-oral mirror)
No difference between the tooth and restoration colour (checked visually with a dental intra-oral mirror)
Surface texture of the restoration is similar to tooth structure (manually checked with the tip of a dental hand instrument - explorer)
No visual evidence of dark discolouration adjacent to the margins of the restoration (checked visually with a dental intra-oral mirror)
Restoration closely adapted to the tooth. No crevice visible (manually checked with the tip of a dental hand instrument - explorer)

arm_group.description: Resin-modified glass ionomer (RMGI - Fuji 2 LC) Class V restorations performed by by 3rd and 4th-year dental students in adult patients of Schulich dental clinic over the last three years will be evaluated using mirrors and probes.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Class V Glass ionomer - GIC Restorations
arm_group.description: Glass ionomer (GI - Fuji 9) Class V restorations performed by by 3rd and 4th-year dental students in adult patients of Schulich dental clinic over the last three years will be evaluated using mirrors and probes.

intervention.intervention_name: Retrospective evaluation of RMGI and GIC Class V Restorations
intervention.description: Retrospective evaluation of RMGI and GIC Class V Restorations that were placed by dental students over the last three years were evaluated using the modified USPHS criteria using mirrors and probes.
intervention.arm_group_label: Class V Glass ionomer - GIC Restorations

study_pop.textblock: Adults that have Class V Ionomer restorations (RMGI and GIC) placed by 3rd and 4th dental students at the Schulich Dental Clinic over the last three years.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
â€¢ Class V Ionomer restorations (RMGI and GIC) placed by 3rd and 4th dental students over the last three years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Class V Restorations placed outside of the dental school
- Class V Restorations that used other restorative materials Class V Ionomer restorations (RMGI and GIC0 placed before three years on the time of evaluation.

facility.name: Schulich Medicine and Dentistry - Western University

Franco EB, Benetti AR, Ishikiriama SK, Santiago SL, Lauris JR, Jorge MF, Navarro MF. 5-year clinical performance of resin composite versus resin modified glass ionomer restorative system in non-carious cervical lesions. Oper Dent. 2006 Jul-Aug;31(4):403-8.
van Dijken JW. Retention of a resin-modified glass ionomer adhesive in non-carious cervical lesions. A 6-year follow-up. J Dent. 2005 Aug;33(7):541-7. Epub 2005 Feb 8.

Imbery TA, Namboodiri A, Duncan A, Amos R, Best AM, Moon PC. Evaluating dentin surface treatments for resin-modified glass ionomer restorative materials. Oper Dent. 2013 Jul-Aug;38(4):429-38. doi: 10.2341/12-162-L. Epub 2012 Oct 22.
